title: Grade 11 - Marketing: Goods, Services, Events BMI3C (2006)
subject: Business Studies

document.title: Grade 11 - Marketing: Goods, Services, Events BMI3C (2006)

F0EBE8053A484A1C9D1ED2D989666812.description: explain how essential skills (e.g., HRSDC essential skills) and employability skills (e.g., organizational, planning, timemanagement, information technology skills) are acquired through the preparation and implementation of a marketing plan

209F8D270EA64665A7BF5192267753F7.description: explain how a marketing plan can address the areas of ethics and social responsibility (e.g., by identifying diverse markets, by requiring environmentally friendly components in the product and its packaging, by incorporating positive social messages for healthy products);

E34528F17E514D9287F1302160E63E15.description: identify the reasons why stakeholders (e.g., executive decision makers, business owners, bankers, investors, board of directors) would be interested in a marketing plan;

83B29576C0524D7BBF0F7E0572805A54.description: explain how a marketing plan is used as a strategic tool (e.g., to determine future growth of a business, develop new products, expand domestic markets, enter foreign markets);

5DFE69EF82E74D6BBD845E724FDC38D3.description: The Analysis: analyse the uses of a marketing plan.

7BDC8522EE5F40B49C244B60C8F8FAE6.description: produce a marketing plan for the selected product, using current information technology.

0257E0F5D14B40BD8765369220AE92E3.description: apply the marketing mix to the selected product;

09BB0FCC1AF34C93B4F168A33A598739.description: outline a strategic plan (e.g., goals, marketing research, purpose of product, mission statement) for a real or simulated product (good, service, or event);

9B6218367EB040B8877FDA4D15C65B2D.description: The Development: develop a marketing plan for a good, service, or event;

F4F36838AF4747D095DDAA6C720A86A5.description: explain the difference between a marketing plan and a venture plan

0589433A314A42E191CD0D9283693B18.description: describe the steps and stages in the creation of a marketing plan for a good, service, or event;

1CC1C90313264A278662FA0FD116EB53.description: identify resources (e.g., Internet support sites, business planning templates, regional economic centres) available to assist in the development of a marketing plan;

A7ABF751123B4AC9AA9C7B9A6AC5F33E.description: The Process:  explain the process of developing a marketing plan;

E74DF98C6CF042528412A35CD3FC786E.description: using a variety of sources (e.g., the Internet, Human Resources and Social Development Canada [HRSDC], National Occupational Classifications), research and summarize the tasks, remuneration, and employment opportunities in marketing occupations ranging from entry level to management

D098C68FF21B42D384C859163B4344BB.description: classify employment opportunities by marketing function (e.g., sales, transportation, advertising);

4B2AE0ED600942028753D0A8DAF824BC.description: identify growth areas in the marketing of postsecondary education and employment (e.g., postsecondary institutions and/or private-sector training companies, sports and entertainment, information technology, project management, logistics, nonprofit and not-for-profit marketing);

422ECD8FD1B842A0B7F229AC18BA56BE.description: Career Paths in Marketing: summarize, on the basis of computer research, career pathways in marketing

9016428344F145F9B055CE9BA8936620.description: outline the risk factors that should be considered when entering foreign markets (e.g., bribes, kickbacks, political instability).

3C2EDB6C56254983A0F9D96EC16FD308.description: describe the factors leading to the development of global markets (e.g., the growth of information technology, common currencies, multinational corporations, immigration);

514E4E4F275C43C0BC6C8DE02EDC3B1E.description: outline the relative importance of major consumer and industrial markets around the world (e.g., China; the Pacific Rim; the European Union; North, Central, and South America);

0291F80F1665439D96A75567EE8F5893.description: International Markets: demonstrate an understanding of the potential for participation in the global marketplace;

886BE8E62EB94476A606717570AC5EDB.description: identify channels through which consumers can express objections to specific marketing activities (e.g., the Canadian Advertising Foundation, the Consumers' Association of Canada, the Canadian Radio-Television and Telecommunications Commission)

E810D585439642CFAAA2F1A89FD42174.description: identify examples of businesses that include corporate social responsibility as a component of their marketing philosophy (e.g., not using animals in product testing, sponsoring charitable events, hosting children's camps, engaging in responsible environmental practices);

AAA33FDE27B94EFB872FE1FC9473374C.description: explain the need for firms to demonstrate good corporate citizenship and organizational ethics in their day-to-day marketing practices (e.g., truth in advertising, confidentiality of marketing research, observing regulations regarding advertising to children, informing consumers of safety issues);

AD6186E51EE04938A3C873B6479C74B2.description: describe ways in which marketing activities (e.g., packaging, labelling) have been influenced by increasing concern for the environment;

E868AC7A63CE42A6BE0722B9E6EBC8B6.description: identify marketing issues created by changes in information technology (e.g., expanding markets; privacy issues; consumers' reactions to junk mail, spam, and information overload);

560F6F8B75314FDE9BB4F1106100A247.description: Issues, Ethics, and Social Responsibility in Marketing: identify and describe various environmental, ethical, social, and legal issues that affect marketing activities;

F7C7738A56544792AE2A44DBD85177B1.description: describe how fashion, fads, and trends (e.g., buying behaviour, conspicuous consumption) are influenced by the immediacy characteristic of the electronic age

578A93EAD58C467380F5A3CA0323DFA6.description: describe the effects that new communication technologies have on marketing in a business environment (e.g., with respect to business etiquette, use of language, literacy standards in business);

69CC3B9F806F4638A407962A9B175E29.description: explain how emerging information technologies (e.g., wireless communication, digital technology) have affected the dynamic nature of marketing and stimulated the rate of change in marketing strategies;

061A191492A74D84AE9F187C9CF72CF8.description: identify advances in electronic commerce applications (e.g., web-page design, order entry systems, database design for market research) and describe how these advances have affected business-to-business and business-to-consumer marketing;

CFE07DBB801E46DCAE6A5B23ADDCCDC1.description: Information Technology in Marketing: explain the effects of new information technologies on marketing strategies and consumer trends;

0A6152EDDADF4D35B4DFC9893D2E00A1.description: create a variety of print, audiovisual, and electronic promotions (e.g., magazine, newspaper, television, radio, Internet, specialty advertising) for different audiences.

54164D4F2AE142BFBC0A04710CC416E5.description: describe the role of public relations as a component of promotional strategies;

483C4297CB8C4142BDD4BA4E80A5A3DD.description: assess the effectiveness of various advertising media and tools (e.g., the Internet, television, magazines, billboards, radio; pop-ups, press releases, mass e-mailings);

DAE39E33ABDB4244A4D5A1D723699675.description: identify the various elements of promotion (e.g., advertising, publicity, sales promotion, public relations, personal selling);

298FEFB811B8478EB29A92691F330063.description: Promotion: demonstrate an understanding of the strategies involved in the promotion of goods, services, and events

4176D8420AA440BD88CD5774848A911B.description: assess, on the basis of research, the impact of technology, including information technology, on channels of distribution and inventory control systems (e.g., global positioning system [GPS] tracking, automated billing, smart shelving).

1CEE1546F5A145A88CBAFDBAE0CF1F15.description: explain different systems of inventory control (e.g., just-in-time inventory, warehousing, overstocking, understocking);

93FBA8EE0D2A4B048D24090116ABC133.description: compare the advantages and disadvantages of the various ways of delivering goods and services (e.g., truck, train, plane, auto, the Internet) from the producer to the consumer;

597C31584B4D4F81AF10FF8C670ED1C9.description: identify the channels of distribution for a variety of products in a variety of markets (e.g., direct, indirect, integrated, and specialty channels);

7268DEC2B1F4450193FB6F118E387D34.description: Place: compare a variety of distribution strategies and the logistics associated with them;

72E142B91DCE42819DEAF3A921BC739E.description: identify the pricing strategies and policies used to promote the sale of products (e.g., skimming, market penetration, loss leader, supersizing, combo pricing, discount pricing, volume discounts).

FA2316F4898A4B828A96F6013A24232E.description: determine the price for a product, using relevant financial data (e.g., calculate total cost, break-even point, selling price, gross profit margin);

8FC665027D714F1FA9C04910C58C06A6.description: describe the factors that affect the price of products (e.g., fixed and variable costs, economies of scale, supply and demand);

B7DA78C0CE8149A29085C6C2EAF605B2.description: Price: explain the factors involved in the pricing of goods, services, and events;

92F3A79730D142458F8081F8DC420A8F.description: conduct a marketing research activity for a good, service, or event (e.g., taste test, online survey, focus group).

7C044D0D764D471E98EBD7AB6690BFD1.description: identify regulations (e.g., Canadian Consumer Packaging and Labelling Act, laws and practices of other countries) affecting packaging and labelling strategies (e.g., generic, private, name brand);

2DF2F1CDDD314519B5A38A523C8941AA.description: using consumer profiles, explain how products are positioned in various market segments (e.g., socio-economic groups, specific ethnocultural groups, groups with specific lifestyles);

772799EBFABC41909CFB231311F20C1B.description: explain the importance of branding in product positioning;

E713BB7A4B2F48A8BDF4C96E45700131.description: identify the components of the product life cycle for different types of products (e.g., staples, fads, fashions);

EB4FDAC6D44342D6ACED7BF11C0B1A03.description: classify products according to type (e.g., good, service, event; consumer, industrial, institutional);

A1BCAB818CAC4734B5CC70CD96F1AAB6.description: Products: Goods, Services, and Event: explain the stages of product development;

E30ACD1004F640F9BF93025584D12C9D.description: describe the impact of foreign and domestic policies, agencies (e.g., marketing boards, regulatory bodies), and issues (e.g., product and food safety, disease control, national security) on marketing activities.

2D00849C99E84DEDBCDC087EC86560F8.description: outline an innovative marketing strategy to be used when entering a new foreign market;

605C26D8D9774901A28E680DB39B5DE5.description: identify ways in which information technology influences global marketing strategies and techniques (e.g., e-mail, online sales and promotions, logistics);

B5C96CF1FDD24B2F83A8E15797446A33.description: describe, drawing on computer research, ethnocultural, linguistic, and geographical factors that firms should consider when they enter the global market (e.g., cultural variations in consumer preference and buying behaviour, language barriers, expense of delivery to distant markets);

A151EE628375407ABA654C0414F4652E.description: Global Marketing: compare the factors that influence marketing methods and activities in the global economy

A60213409FED4BDF85F942FF201D6059.description: compare the purposes of marketing for profit and not-for-profit organizations (e.g., to sell products and lifestyles, to raise funds, to raise awareness about issues)

0C8F8E495ADC475C9629025FE68BC298.description: identify ways in which not-for-profit and government organizations market their goods, services, and events;

6A01B316689B4E4D9084A88C7FF511A8.description: identify the characteristics and features of not-for-profit organizations;

9BBC1DE388B948FAA774615AAC3FA619.description: Not-for-Profit Marketing: analyse marketing strategies used by organizations in the not-for-profit sector;

AF04E1647F864F8EA6B0A68DB7344E43.description: describe the use of data mining to gather marketing-related information (e.g., target market, competition, buying behaviour).

A17D3A94CB514204BD81AC229EAE6984.description: identify tools, techniques, and information technologies that can be used to interpret consumer and market data (e.g., pie charts, polls, databases) and demonstrate the use of these tools, techniques, and information technologies

81402957F34148BAB740A534449D5A2D.description: create an example of a current marketing research tool (e.g., focus group questionnaire, electronic web survey)

5582462B57A549E4B19137661483AD37.description: outline the role and importance of marketing research in business (e.g., providing feedback on product development, identifying the target market, determining appropriate channels of distribution)

156F8BF0B9AE4AFF8AF0F42C0E18743A.description: Marketing Research: demonstrate an understanding of the importance of marketing research to a business and how information technology can be used to obtain and analyse marketing-related information

F76728EED6F441C6AE6CB2A0680CA5C2.description: describe how evolving information technologies are used to influence, inform, and motivate consumers (e.g.,corporate websites,e-commerce,Internet pop-up ads).

4123419826364242B40D2F39B721C78B.description: explain how marketing (e.g., branding, promotion, packaging, online sales) affects competition among products

100AA36C15C1458E87B606144460B063.description: summarize the factors that motivate a customer to purchase a product (e.g., discretionary income, peer pressure, social responsibility, evolving needs and wants)

B26BD05D26A44B9EB0B2759363270C59.description: describe the process used by firms to develop a consumer profile (e.g., consumers' demographic, economic, and social characteristics)

7C589CFEB04A45B8B0345AE3A3998E2B.description: Consumers and Competition: explain how marketing influences consumers and competition

4D78356710F0451490AB29C90B0C6FA9.description: describe current marketing activities that target various market segments (e.g., youth, baby boomers, Generation X, seniors).

7B0A8E55FA334829911FE528FB829771.description: describe current marketing strategies that use total quality management (e.g., Quality Circle, Kaizen), customer-driven information technology (e.g., smart cards, point programs), and target marketing (e.g., market segmentation, classification of advertising)

3A64C35E213A458CB104B5C60C94C1A8.description: compare how supply and demand affect marketing decisions

9A2BD117F19F471B9C2A0B8BC1D1C215.description: define the basic nature and scope of marketing activities (e.g., sales, pricing, branding, distribution, storage)

47743D7A7F684FC09859D0D4924DDAE1.description: The Marketing Process: describe the process by which goods and services are exchanged
